extends Polygon

    • Constructor Detail

      • Quadrilateral

        public Quadrilateral(double baseABLength,
                     double sideACLength,
                     double sideBDLength,
                     double angleA,
                     double angleB)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Main constructor for class Quadrilateral. This constructor will compute the area and perimeter and give it to the superclasses constructor, validate the angles used to compute the length of the top side (CD), compute the quadrilateral's coordinates and then use those coordinates to create a side object representing each side of the quadrilateral.
        Parameters:
        baseABLength - the length of the side from vertex A to vertex B
        sideACLength - the length of the side from vertex A to vertex C
        sideBDLength - the length of the side from vertex B to vertex D
        angleA - the magnitude of the interior angle at vertex A
        angleB - the magnitude of the interior angle at vertex B
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the angles are out of range

    • Method Detail

      • validateAngle

        private static void validateAngle(double angle)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method validates an interior angle of a quadrilateral making sure it does not extend past 179 degrees or below 1 degree. This would make an invalid quadrilateral.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle to validate
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the angle is not in the range desired

      • computeQuadrilateralCoordinates

        private static Vertex[] computeQuadrilateralCoordinates(double baseABLength,
                                                        double sideACLength,
                                                        double sideBDLength,
                                                        double angleA,
                                                        double angleB)
        This method will compute the coordinates of a quadrilateral. It sets the A and B coordinates so that the base side is along the x-axis starting from the origin. It returns a list of vertices with each vertex representing each vertex of the quadrilateral.
        Parameters:
        baseABLength - the length of the side from vertex A to vertex B
        sideACLength - the length of the side from vertex A to vertex C
        sideBDLength - the length of the side from vertex B to vertex D
        angleA - the magnitude of the interior angle at vertex A
        angleB - the magnitude of the interior angle at vertex B
        Returns:
        an array of vertices designated by the static final vertex indexes.

      • computeVertexC

        public static Vertex computeVertexC(double angleA,
                                    double sideACLength)
        This method will compute the x and y coordinates of the C vertex using the SOHCAHTOA method and its respective trigonometric properties.
        Parameters:
        angleA - the interior angle of the quadrilateral associated with vertex A
        sideACLength - the length of the side from vertex A to vertex C
        Returns:
        a Vertex object containing the x and y coordinates of the C vertex

      • computeVertexD

        public static Vertex computeVertexD(double angleB,
                                    double baseABLength,
                                    double sideBDLength)
        This method will compute the x and y coordinates of the D vertex using the SOHCAHTOA method. We must offset the x calculation by the base length because the calculation computes the components in regards to the B vertex. We also must flip the angle by subtracting it by 180 degrees because the trigonometric identities compute it facing the right side.
        Parameters:
        angleB - the interior angle of the quadrilateral associated with vertex B
        baseABLength - the length of the base
        sideBDLength - the length of the side b/t vertex B and D
        Returns:
        a Vertex object containing the x and y coordinates of the D vertex

      • computePerimeter

        private static double computePerimeter(double baseABLength,
                                       double sideACLength,
                                       double sideBDLength,
                                       double angleA,
                                       double angleB)
        This method will compute the perimeter by computing the length of the top side and then adding together the length of each side.
        Parameters:
        baseABLength - the length of the side from vertex A to vertex B
        sideACLength - the length of the side from vertex A to vertex C
        sideBDLength - the length of the side from vertex B to vertex D
        angleA - the magnitude of the interior angle at vertex A
        angleB - the magnitude of the interior angle at vertex B
        Returns:
        the perimeter of the quadrilateral

      • computeArea

        public static double computeArea(double baseABLength,
                                 double sideACLength,
                                 double sideBDLength,
                                 double angleA,
                                 double angleB)
        This method will use Bretschneider's formula to compute the area of a quadrilateral.
        Parameters:
        baseABLength - the length of the side from vertex A to vertex B
        sideACLength - the length of the side from vertex A to vertex C
        sideBDLength - the length of the side from vertex B to vertex D
        angleA - the magnitude of the interior angle at vertex A
        angleB - the magnitude of the interior angle at vertex B
        Returns:
        the area of the quadrilateral

      • drawQuadrilateral

        public void drawQuadrilateral(java.awt.Graphics g,
                              int centerX,
                              int centerY)
        This method used the Graphics object passed to it to draw the quadrilateral object using the current coordinates. To draw, use this method inside an Overridden paintComponent method.
        Parameters:
        g - the AWT Graphics object
        centerX - the x-coordinate of the center of the panel
        centerY - the y-coordinate of the center of the panel

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string containing the values of the area and perimeter for this object
